flawed_nl_solution:
A leap year is one day shorter than a regular year, so it is 365 - 1 = <<365-1=364>>364 days.
Brittany washes her hair every other day, so she will wash it 364 / 2 = <<364/2=182>>182 times in a leap year.
A bottle of shampoo lasts her 14 / 1 / 4 = 14 * 4 = 35 washes.
If she buys 3 bottles, she will only have enough for 35 * 3 = <<3*35=105>>105 washes.
If she buys 4 bottles, she will have enough for 35 * 4 = <<4*35=140>>140 washes.
Since 105 < 182 and 140 > 182, Brittany needs 4 bottles of shampoo to get her through a leap year.
#### 4

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 3.5, not 35. It appears the decimal point was misplaced.
